text: João Pedro Matos Fernandes (born 1967) is a Portuguese politician serving as Minister of Environment . He has a bachelor's degree in civil engineering from the University of Porto and a master's degree in transport from Instituto Superior Técnico. Fernandes served as president of the Portuguese Port Authorities' Association from 2008 to 2010, and as chairman of the Viana do Castelo Port Authority from 2009 to 2012. ==References== Category:1967 births Category:Living people Category:Government ministers of Portugal Category:People from Águeda
title: João Pedro Matos Fernandes
